what: Non-negative Matrix Factorization for Binary Data
title: Non-negative Matrix Factorization for Binary Data
text: nmfbin R package provides simple Non-Negative Matrix Factorization (NMF) implementation tailored binary data matrices. offers choice initialization methods, loss functions updating algorithms. Unlike NMF packages, one focused (1) binary (Boolean) data (2) minimizing dependencies. Note package early stages development.

title: Non-negative Matrix Factorization for Binary Data
text: can install development version nmfbin GitHub :

title: Non-negative Matrix Factorization for Binary Data
code: # load library(nmfbin)  # Create a binary matrix for demonstration X <- matrix(sample(c(0, 1), 100, replace=TRUE), ncol=10)  # Perform NMF results <- nmfbin(X, k=3, optimizer = "mur", init = "nndsvd")

title: Non-negative Matrix Factorization for Binary Data
code: @Manual{,   title = {nmfbin: Non-negative Matrix Factorization for Binary Data},   author = {Michal Ovadek},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.2.0},   url = {https://michalovadek.github.io/nmfbin/}, }

title: Non-negative Matrix Factorization for Binary Data
text: Contributions nmfbin package welcome. Please submit pull requests open issue discussion.

title: Logistic Non-negative Matrix Factorization — nmfbin
text: function performs Logistic Non-negative Matrix Factorization (NMF) binary matrix.

title: Logistic Non-negative Matrix Factorization — nmfbin
code: nmfbin(   X,   k,   optimizer = "mur",   init = "nndsvd",   max_iter = 1000,   tol = 1e-06,   learning_rate = 0.001,   verbose = FALSE,   loss_fun = "logloss",   loss_normalize = TRUE,   epsilon = 1e-10 )

title: Logistic Non-negative Matrix Factorization — nmfbin
text: X binary matrix (m x n) factorized. k number factors components. optimizer Type updating algorithm. update NMF multiplicative update rules gradient gradient descent. init Method initializing factorization. max_iter Maximum number iterations gradient descent optimization. tol Convergence tolerance. optimization stops change loss less value. learning_rate Learning rate (step size) gradient descent optimization. verbose Print convergence TRUE. loss_fun Choice loss function. loss_normalize Normalize loss TRUE. epsilon Constant avoid log(0).

title: Logistic Non-negative Matrix Factorization — nmfbin
text: list containing: W: basis matrix (m x k). H: coefficient matrix (k x n). c: global threshold.

title: Logistic Non-negative Matrix Factorization — nmfbin
code: if (FALSE) { # Generate a binary matrix of size 100 x 50 set.seed(123) m <- 100 n <- 50 X <- matrix(sample(c(0, 1), m * n, replace = TRUE), m, n)  # Set the number of factors k <- 4  # Apply the function result <- nmfbin(X, k) }
